basic_info.name: Eneda Xhambazi
basic_info.description:
I'm a full-stack JavaScript web developer specializing in the MERN (MongoDB, Express, React, and Node) stack. I strive to create dynamic web applications that are both sophisticated and user-friendly.

As a lifelong writer, I had always been fascinated by the endless possibilities of coding, which seemed to me a new and exciting art form. I finally began pursuing my curiosity in 2020 when I decided to take an online web development bootcamp course on Udemy. Since then, through various online courses and projects, I've faced many exciting challenges that have allowed me to develop my creative problem-solving abilities and refine my attention to detail. I am most proud of my passion project, t'day, an anonymous social networking site I call ''the world's first collective online journal'', which you can read more about below. 

When I'm not coding, you can find me writing, exploring the great outdoors, trying out new vegetarian recipes in the kitchen or playing with my beloved cat Rigby. üê± If you're looking for someone who is passionate about bringing ideas to life through web development, please don't hesitate to reach out. I'd love to hear from you!

projects.title: Animal Shelter
projects.description: The most expanded application I had opportunity to work with. I've learned many technologies and my code was reviewed by awesome curator. Application handles all adoption processess and allows to store all evidence on adopting animals from animal shelter.

projects.title: Photography
projects.description: Personal project for study subject. I was responsible for testing photography application that optimizes images with popular algorithms used by graphic editors like Pixlr or Adobe Photoshop. I've earned A grade :)

projects.title: 3D Object Viewer
projects.description: One of the first apps I was working on my internship. I had to develop front-end implementation for app that shows 3D models of known buildings. This was also my first project in Angular framework. I've learned a lot!
